meanings.definition: The practice of persuading someone to do something by using force or threats.
meanings.sent1: The bully resorted to coercion to make the other kids give him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The criminal used coercion to make the witness lie in court.
meanings.sent3: The cat used coercion to convince the mouse to come out of its hole.
meanings.sent4: The storm's coercion of the trees made them bend and sway in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dictator's coercion of the citizens instilled fear and obedience in the population.

meanings.definition: The action or practice of persuading someone to do something by using force or threats.
meanings.sent1: The government's coercion of the protestors led to a violent clash.
meanings.sent2: The coercion by the kidnappers forced the victim to reveal the secret location.
meanings.sent3: The magician's coercion of the audience to believe in his tricks amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The coercion of time made the decision urgent and crucial.
meanings.sent5: The coercion of the waves against the shore eroded the cliffs over time.
